intro: Stoebe incana var. macrostachya, commonly known as hoary blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its fuzzy, grayish-blue foliage. The plant produces small, blue to violet flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Stoebe incana var. macrostachya is an herbaceous perennial that spreads via rhizomes, forming dense colonies.
